creator: Siilo Holding B.V.
descriptionHtml:
Siilo is a secure medical messaging app designed to help healthcare professionals and teams better collaborate on difficult cases, improve patient care, and share knowledge in a compliant way. Join over a quarter-million active users in Europe’s largest medical network.

ENSURE PATIENT DATA SECURITY
- End-to-end Encryption
- PIN Code Protection – secure your conversations and data
- Secure Media Library – separate personal and professional photos, videos, and files
- Photo Editing – guarantee patient privacy with blur tool and treatment accuracy with arrows
- GDPR, ISO-27001, NHS Complaint

LEVERAGE THE POWER OF THE NETWORK
- User Verification – trust who you’re talking to
- Medical Directory – connect with colleagues in your organisation, regionally, or globally
- Profiles – provide essential details for other Siilo users to better find you

IMPROVE QUALITY OF PATIENT CARE
- Cases – discuss anonymised patient cases separately within general chat threads
- Groups – contact and bring together the right people at the right time

Siilo is GDPR, ISO-27001, and NHS compliant and partners with reputable healthcare associations such as AGIK and KAVA, as well as hospitals like UMC Utrecht, Erasmus MC, and departments at Charité to deliver organisational and departmental collaboration.

Siilo | Practice Medicine Together


Testimonials:
“Siilo has great potential to control and manage major incidents. We’ve seen the benefits of WhatsApp in these situations, but with Siilo the benefits are even greater — it’s highly intuitive, familiar and it’s ready to use.”
– Darren Lui, Spinal and Orthopaedic Surgeon at St George’s Hospital, UK

“Regional networks require optimal collaboration between primary and secondary care. By creating a regional network together with primary care physicians, we can effectively serve all people affected. With Siilo, the Red Cross Hospital specialists are demonstrating leadership by sharing knowledge and expertise, even beyond hospital walls.”
– Dr. Gonneke Hermanides, Infectious Disease Specialist, Red Cross Hospital Beverwijk Netherlands

“The possibilities we have with Siilo are enormous because we can receive very quick responses from our clinical peers securely from all over the country and benefit from different opinions on how best to treat patients.”
– Professor Holger Nef, cardiologist and deputy medical director at The University Hospital of Giessen and director of the Heart Centre Rotenburg

“Everyone has interesting patient cases, but that information is not stored nationwide. With Siilo you can search the cases and see if someone asked the question before.”
– Anke Kylstra, AIOS Hospital Pharmacy in the Maxima Medical Center, JongNVZA board member

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
We've simplified group management! Tap on the group name to learn more about it. When inviting new members to a group, you will be prompted to connect if the prospective member is not a contact or to send a Siilo invite if the prospective member is not a user. Admins now have greater control over who can add new members.

We've also resumed our verification process to ensure users are always connecting to a real person. Unverified users will be prompted to start the process from Profiles.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
We’ve improved Voice & Video calling for mobile and is now available on Web! Users can now make a call via the chat screen or a user profile and switch between voice and video calling in real time. All calls now sync between the mobile app and Siilo Web, enabling users to answer where it's most convenient. Minor interface changes simplify how calls are viewed and made.
In addition, QR codes are now scannable with regular device cameras.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
In our latest update, new users can be more specific about job title with our expanded profession list! They can also indicate if they are “in training” for their chosen profession. Current users can contact Team Siilo to update their job titles to more accurately reflect their professions.

We’ve also improved Voice & Video calling for mobile and made it available for Siilo Web, as well as made it possible for Siilo QR codes to be scanned by regular device cameras.

- User Verification – trust who you’re talking to
- Medical Directory – connect with colleagues in your organisation, regionally, or globally
- Profiles – provide essential details for other Siilo users to better find you

IMPROVE QUALITY OF PATIENT CARE
- Cases – discuss anonymised patient cases separately within general chat threads
- Groups – contact and bring together the right people at the right time

Siilo is GDPR, ISO-27001, and NHS compliant and partners with reputable healthcare associations such as AGIK and KAVA, as well as hospitals like UMC Utrecht, Erasmus MC, and departments at Charité to deliver organisational and departmental collaboration.

Siilo | Practice Medicine Together


Testimonials:

“Siilo has great potential to control and manage major incidents. We’ve seen the benefits of WhatsApp in these situations, but with Siilo the benefits are even greater — it’s highly intuitive, familiar and it’s ready to use.”
– Darren Lui, Spinal and Orthopaedic Surgeon at St George’s Hospital, UK

“Regional networks require optimal collaboration between primary and secondary care. By creating a regional network together with primary care physicians, we can effectively serve all people affected. With Siilo, the Red Cross Hospital specialists are demonstrating leadership by sharing knowledge and expertise, even beyond hospital walls.”
– Dr. Gonneke Hermanides, Infectious Disease Specialist, Red Cross Hospital Beverwijk Netherlands

“The possibilities we have with Siilo are enormous because we can receive very quick responses from our clinical peers securely from all over the country and benefit from different opinions on how best to treat patients.”
– Professor Holger Nef, cardiologist and deputy medical director at The University Hospital of Giessen and director of the Heart Centre Rotenburg

“Everyone has interesting patient cases, but that information is not stored nationwide. With Siilo you can search the cases and see if someone asked the question before.”
– Anke Kylstra, AIOS Hospital Pharmacy in the Maxima Medical Center, JongNVZA board member

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
In Siilo's latest update, new contacts no longer appear at the top of your Chats tab and push down your important conversations! Instead you can find these contacts in the Spaces tab under "People in my network", and you will only be notified of new colleagues once per week.

We've also crushed the usual bugs and continue to make updates behind the scenes to improve the stability and security of our app. Questions? Message us at Team Siilo!

In this update, we've fixed a bug that prevented you from posting cases in your organisation network tiles, as well as from saving PDFs to your Siilo Media. As a bonus, we added the option to save audio files!

title: Siilo - Medical Messenger

creator: Siilo Holding B.V.
descriptionHtml:
Siilo is a secure medical messaging app designed to help healthcare professionals and teams better collaborate on difficult cases, improve patient care, and share knowledge in a compliant way. Join over a quarter-million active users in Europe’s largest medical network.

ENSURE PATIENT DATA SECURITY
- End-to-end Encryption
- PIN Code Protection – secure your conversations and data
- Secure Media Library – separate personal and professional photos, videos, and files
- Photo Editing – guarantee patient privacy with blur tool and treatment accuracy with arrows
- GDPR, ISO-27001, NHS Complaint

LEVERAGE THE POWER OF THE NETWORK
- User Verification – trust who you’re talking to
- Medical Directory – connect with colleagues in your organisation, regionally, or globally
- Profiles – provide essential details for other Siilo users to better find you

IMPROVE QUALITY OF PATIENT CARE
- Cases – discuss anonymised patient cases separately within general chat threads
- Groups – contact and bring together the right people at the right time

Siilo is GDPR, ISO-27001, and NHS compliant and partners with reputable healthcare associations such as AGIK and KAVA, as well as hospitals like UMC Utrecht, Erasmus MC, and departments at Charité to deliver organisational and departmental collaboration.

Siilo | Practice Medicine Together


Testimonials:

“Siilo has great potential to control and manage major incidents. We’ve seen the benefits of WhatsApp in these situations, but with Siilo the benefits are even greater — it’s highly intuitive, familiar and it’s ready to use.”
– Darren Lui, Spinal and Orthopaedic Surgeon at St George’s Hospital, UK

“Regional networks require optimal collaboration between primary and secondary care. By creating a regional network together with primary care physicians, we can effectively serve all people affected. With Siilo, the Red Cross Hospital specialists are demonstrating leadership by sharing knowledge and expertise, even beyond hospital walls.”
– Dr. Gonneke Hermanides, Infectious Disease Specialist, Red Cross Hospital Beverwijk Netherlands

“The possibilities we have with Siilo are enormous because we can receive very quick responses from our clinical peers securely from all over the country and benefit from different opinions on how best to treat patients.”
– Professor Holger Nef, cardiologist and deputy medical director at The University Hospital of Giessen and director of the Heart Centre Rotenburg

“Everyone has interesting patient cases, but that information is not stored nationwide. With Siilo you can search the cases and see if someone asked the question before.”
– Anke Kylstra, AIOS Hospital Pharmacy in the Maxima Medical Center, JongNVZA board member

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
In this update, we've improved the user experience of the chat actions. Mute and Keep actions are now part of the chat details views, next to other chat details and profile info. Give it a go after updating your Siilo app! This new feature is available for both direct messages and group chats.

You can still Mute, Keep with a long press on the chat from the Chats tab.

Have any questions? Message us at Team Siilo!

Finally you can set your status to available or unavailable using the app! Use it for out-of-office or set unavailability for a few hours. When you are unavailable, all notifications will be muted, and people that message you will be notified that you are unavailable. Go to your profile to set your status, try it out!

Have any questions? Message us at Team Siilo!

“Siilo has great potential to control and manage major incidents. We’ve seen the benefits of WhatsApp in these situations, but with Siilo the benefits are even greater — it’s highly intuitive, familiar and it’s ready to use.”
– Darren Lui, Spinal and Orthopaedic Surgeon at St George’s Hospital, UK

“Regional networks require optimal collaboration between primary and secondary care. By creating a regional network together with primary care physicians, we can effectively serve all people affected. With Siilo, the Red Cross Hospital specialists are demonstrating leadership by sharing knowledge and expertise, even beyond hospital walls.”
– Dr. Gonneke Hermanides, Infectious Disease Specialist, Red Cross Hospital Beverwijk Netherlands

“The possibilities we have with Siilo are enormous because we can receive very quick responses from our clinical peers securely from all over the country and benefit from different opinions on how best to treat patients.”
– Professor Holger Nef, cardiologist and deputy medical director at The University Hospital of Giessen and director of the Heart Centre Rotenburg

“Everyone has interesting patient cases, but that information is not stored nationwide. With Siilo you can search the cases and see if someone asked the question before.”
– Anke Kylstra, AIOS Hospital Pharmacy in the Maxima Medical Center, JongNVZA board member

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
Finally you can set your status to available or unavailable using the app! Use it for out-of-office or set unavailability for a few hours. When you are unavailable, all notifications will be muted, and people that message you will be notified that you are unavailable. Go to your profile to set your status, try it out!

Have any questions? Message us at Team Siilo!

creator: Siilo Holding B.V.
descriptionHtml:
Siilo is a secure medical messaging app designed to help healthcare professionals and teams better collaborate on difficult cases, improve patient care, and share knowledge in a compliant way. Join over a quarter-million active users in Europe’s largest medical network.

ENSURE PATIENT DATA SECURITY
- End-to-end Encryption
- PIN Code Protection – secure your conversations and data
- Secure Media Library – separate personal and professional photos, videos, and files
- Photo Editing – guarantee patient privacy with blur tool and treatment accuracy with arrows
- GDPR, ISO-27001, NHS Complaint

LEVERAGE THE POWER OF THE NETWORK
- User Verification – trust who you’re talking to
- Medical Directory – connect with colleagues in your organisation, regionally, or globally
- Profiles – provide essential details for other Siilo users to better find you

IMPROVE QUALITY OF PATIENT CARE
- Cases – discuss anonymised patient cases separately within general chat threads
- Groups – contact and bring together the right people at the right time

Siilo is GDPR, ISO-27001, and NHS compliant and partners with reputable healthcare associations such as AGIK and KAVA, as well as hospitals like UMC Utrecht, Erasmus MC, and departments at Charité to deliver organisational and departmental collaboration.

Siilo | Practice Medicine Together


Testimonials:

“Siilo has great potential to control and manage major incidents. We’ve seen the benefits of WhatsApp in these situations, but with Siilo the benefits are even greater — it’s highly intuitive, familiar and it’s ready to use.”
– Darren Lui, Spinal and Orthopaedic Surgeon at St George’s Hospital, UK

“Regional networks require optimal collaboration between primary and secondary care. By creating a regional network together with primary care physicians, we can effectively serve all people affected. With Siilo, the Red Cross Hospital specialists are demonstrating leadership by sharing knowledge and expertise, even beyond hospital walls.”
– Dr. Gonneke Hermanides, Infectious Disease Specialist, Red Cross Hospital Beverwijk Netherlands

“The possibilities we have with Siilo are enormous because we can receive very quick responses from our clinical peers securely from all over the country and benefit from different opinions on how best to treat patients.”
– Professor Holger Nef, cardiologist and deputy medical director at The University Hospital of Giessen and director of the Heart Centre Rotenburg

“Everyone has interesting patient cases, but that information is not stored nationwide. With Siilo you can search the cases and see if someone asked the question before.”
– Anke Kylstra, AIOS Hospital Pharmacy in the Maxima Medical Center, JongNVZA board member

In Siilo's latest update, we made it possible to play longer video formats in Organisation and Association posts. For all our content creators who love to craft and share long video content with their peers, this one is for you!

We've also shipped a few performance improvements, added support for new passports in our verification system, and solved some bugs to keep the app running smoothly.

Have any questions? Message us at Team Siilo!

Testimonials:

“Siilo has great potential to control and manage major incidents. We’ve seen the benefits of WhatsApp in these situations, but with Siilo the benefits are even greater — it’s highly intuitive, familiar and it’s ready to use.”
– Darren Lui, Spinal and Orthopaedic Surgeon at St George’s Hospital, UK

“Regional networks require optimal collaboration between primary and secondary care. By creating a regional network together with primary care physicians, we can effectively serve all people affected. With Siilo, the Red Cross Hospital specialists are demonstrating leadership by sharing knowledge and expertise, even beyond hospital walls.”

“The possibilities we have with Siilo are enormous because we can receive very quick responses from our clinical peers securely from all over the country and benefit from different opinions on how best to treat patients.”
– Professor Holger Nef, cardiologist and deputy medical director at The University Hospital of Giessen and director of the Heart Centre Rotenburg

“Everyone has interesting patient cases, but that information is not stored nationwide. With Siilo you can search the cases and see if someone asked the question before.”

- Medical Directory – connect with colleagues in your organisation, regionally, or globally
- Profiles – provide essential details for other Doctolib Siilo users to better find you

IMPROVE QUALITY OF PATIENT CARE
- Cases – discuss anonymised patient cases separately within general chat threads
- Groups – contact and bring together the right people at the right time

Doctolib Siilo is built by design to ensure personal data protection and partners with reputable healthcare associations such as AGIK and KAVA, as well as hospitals like UMC Utrecht, Erasmus MC, and departments at Charité to deliver organisational and departmental collaboration.
Doctolib Siilo is part of Doctolib,a French major digital health company.
Know more about Doctolib -> https://about.doctolib.com/

Doctolib Siilo | Practice Medicine Together


Testimonials:

“Siilo has great potential to control and manage major incidents. We’ve seen the benefits of WhatsApp in these situations, but with Siilo the benefits are even greater — it’s highly intuitive, familiar and it’s ready to use.”
– Darren Lui, Spinal and Orthopaedic Surgeon at St George’s Hospital, UK

“Regional networks require optimal collaboration between primary and secondary care. By creating a regional network together with primary care physicians, we can effectively serve all people affected. With Siilo, the Red Cross Hospital specialists are demonstrating leadership by sharing knowledge and expertise, even beyond hospital walls.”
– Dr. Gonneke Hermanides, Infectious Disease Specialist, Red Cross Hospital Beverwijk Netherlands

“The possibilities we have with Siilo are enormous because we can receive very quick responses from our clinical peers securely from all over the country and benefit from different opinions on how best to treat patients.”
– Professor Holger Nef, cardiologist and deputy medical director at The University Hospital of Giessen and director of the Heart Centre Rotenburg

“Everyone has interesting patient cases, but that information is not stored nationwide. With Siilo you can search the cases and see if someone asked the question before.”
– Anke Kylstra, AIOS Hospital Pharmacy in the Maxima Medical Center, JongNVZA board member
